1.text: Use fresh, frozen, or canned peaches.

2.text: Bring a large pot of water to a boil on the stovetop.

3.text: Cut a small X at the bottom of each peach.

5.text: Put the peaches into an ice bath for 1 minute.

6.text: Peel the peaches by hand or use a knife to loosen the skin.

7.text: Dice the peeled peaches into quarters and remove the pits.

8.text: Put the peaches into a stockpot along with 3 tablespoons (44 mL) of liquid.

9.text: Stir and cook the peaches over medium heat for 10 minutes.

10.text: Transfer the hot peaches to a food processor or blender.

11.text: Blend the peaches for 2 minutes or until they are completely smooth.

12.text: Let the puree cool for 10-15 minutes before transferring it to a container.

13.text: Transfer the puree from the processor to an airtight glass container.

14.text: Store peach puree in the fridge for 3-5 days.

15.text: Label the container with the date it was prepared.

16.text: Pour the puree into ice cube trays to freeze baby-sized portions.

17.text: Cover the ice cube tray with a lid or plastic wrap.

18.text: Freeze the ice cube trays for several hours.

19.text: Pop out the frozen chunks of puree and transfer them to a plastic bag.

20.text: Use frozen puree within 3-6 months of freezing it for the best quality.
